Key Arguments: The legislation is based on exceptional circumstances during the COVID-19 pandemic and lacks a comprehensive basis.
It is fundamentally incompatible with freedom of speech and democracy, assuming a paternalistic government role.
The definitions of 'misinformation' and 'disinformation' are vague and open to abuse, leading to potential over-policing by tech companies.
The broad definition of 'harm' could stifle debate on critical public policy issues.
The legislation unfairly excludes government, media, and academics from its scope, creating a double standard.
Notable Quotes: I recommend this draft legislation be scrapped altogether.
This legislation assumes a paternalistic relationship between people and the government.
It is hypocritical because it has a different standard of conduct for government, media and academics than to the people they are meant to represent and serve, ordinary citizens.
